Package networkHandler

Class MinimumSpanningTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • networkHandler.MinimumSpanningTree
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, GraphProperty<java.util.ArrayList<Edge>>
    public class MinimumSpanningTree
extends java.lang.Object
implements GraphProperty<java.util.ArrayList<Edge>>
    Responsible for calculation of a Minimum Spanning Tree for a Graph.
    Author:
    Krzysztof Goroll

      • getMstWeight

        public int getMstWeight()

      • run

        public void run()

        Method responsible for the actual calculation of the property value(s).

        This Method first sorts the Edges into a queue depending on their weights. This queue is then used to check all Edges starting with the "lightest" for creating a tree. If an Edge can be integrated without creating a loop, it becomes part of the MinimumSpanningTree. In the end the doCalculateTotalWeight() method is called to assign a total weight to the calculated tree.

        Specified by:
        run in interface GraphProperty<java.util.ArrayList<Edge>>
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • doFindParent

        public int doFindParent​(int[] parent,
                        int node)
        Finds the parent of a Node Chain of parent pointers from x upwards through the tree until an element is reached whose parent is itself
        Parameters:
        parent - current parent Nodes
        node - node to find the parents for
        Returns:
        parent of node

      • doAssignNewParent

        public void doAssignNewParent​(int[] parent,
                              int x,
                              int y)
        Extend parents of a newly added edge
        Parameters:
        parent - current parents Nodes
        x - parent of the source of appended Node
        y - parent of the target of appended Node

      • printToConsole

        public void printToConsole()

        Method for printing the calculated result(s) as a message to the console.

        This method prints all Edges building the MinimumSpanningTree to the console.

        To do this, their respective Edge.printToConsole() methods are called.

        If the Tree cannot be calculated, an appropriate error message is returned instead.

        Specified by:
        printToConsole in interface GraphProperty<java.util.ArrayList<Edge>>
